website_summaries.verdict: An acceptable choice for consumers who need a basic mat, but lacks the quality of others we tested.
pros: Lightweight design and sewn-on handles make it easy to transport
cons: Some users think the padding feels flimsy

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Foam is so soft/squishy it's useless.
customer_reviews.text: Don't be fooled by the good reviews! This thing is garbage. I'm returning it immediately. The foam is too soft to offer any real protection. I couldn't even do pushups on it without my wrists hurting (something I use mats for regularly). The cover says it's vinyl, but it's cheap nylon that fits loosely. The Harbinger brand mat is only $9 more, and it's a brand whose quality I can count on. This might work for a child's plaything, but not for any actual athletic uses.
customer_reviews.author: FistiFluffs

customer_reviews.title: So-so and no-no
customer_reviews.text: These are ok. The problem with them are the zippers down the side of the item. The problem with the Zippers are that they will cut you. I stopped using these because I received several cuts and scratches while using them and I simply had had enough. In addition to that - the foam inside of them squishes almost instantly and you will find yourself sitting on a thin piece of slippery cloth. Will NOT buy any more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Manning

customer_reviews.title: Good quality mat for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a good quality mat. I don't understand the reviews that are completely slagging it as a piece of garbage, for $30 it's going to be pretty tough to find something better. If you're doing very intense gymnastic routines, I can't vouch that this will do the job absolutely. The cushioning is fairly firm, not like a rock, but not "mushy", either. I don't do "yoga", but I can't imagine that it wouldn't function very well for that. I bought it as an emergency "crash" mattress for my office, and it's the perfect "firmness" for that.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't doing flips over this one
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting something a little thicker and a little longer to be honest. My daughter was expecting the same. I will say that for the price, I guess this is adequately prices. It does slip on the carpet in the house when she is using it and it's not very thick. I think it gives her a little more confidence when doing her back-bends and all that. I would like to have had a thicker mat for her though.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: This is more of a cushion than an exercise mat.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get a decent exercise mat to do aerobics, crunches, push ups and other exercises. This seemed like a decent option but BE WARNED. It's is deceptive. This is more like a cushion than an exercise mat. It's way too soft to the point where if you exert any pressure, you start to sink in. It's like doing a jumping jack on a bed, you're going to sink in or get unbalanced and injure yourself. The thickness doesn't matter when you just sink through it. For a MSRP of $70, and sale price of $40, I DO NOT recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sinnamon

customer_reviews.title: Great for anyone who finds kneeling on a thin mat or floor uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: We bought two mats in different sizes since both my husband and I have had knee replacement surgery and find it difficult to kneel. An added bonus is that these mats fold up and have cloth handles. They are very easy to carry and although they don't roll up they do lay flat for easy storage. The mats are thick enough to make kneeling comfortable and easy to move and store. We haven't had ours long enough to know how durable they are but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Ann-Marie G.

customer_reviews.title: No support. Poor quality foam and casing material.
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality foam cushions and casing material. No support. Thought would be medium grade as original price is $69.99. Photo of women doing yoga pose is deceptive. Lightly press your hand and the foam cushion presses all the way to floor. I get better support using one or two yoga mats. Cheep casing as well. I wanted to use for yoga. Looks like it will rip apart if you are doing aerobic exercises on mat. Also, while returned and did not try, looks like it will throw your standing poses off because foam completely compresses at point of pressure vs. surrounding area on mat.
customer_reviews.author: lokahibodyworks@earthlink.net

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase at an excellent price!!
customer_reviews.text: When our fitness center reopened (briefly) in May we discovered the mats had been removed for sanitary reasons. We both need a mat for padding during some of our exercises so we scoured Amazon to find our own mat we could easily carry to the center. This one has been perfect. It's light-weight, folds easily for convenient carrying, and is extremely comfortable - providing all the padding we need. We now use it at home when we replicate some of our exercises. I would HIGHLY recommend this item and would not hesitate to buy an additional one if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Tucson

customer_reviews.title: Body Comfort Plus
customer_reviews.text: I've only used the mat approximately 3 times so I can't comment on durability yet. I do yoga and participate in an online boot camp. My house is on a cement slab so I definitely needed the cushion. It in no way compares to the gyms professional grade mat, but so far it has made a big difference in at home work outs. In terms of price, comfort, and easy fold ability, I would consider it a must have for at home exercise equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed- This was a Christmas gift and within days it already has split on the sides!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Campion

customer_reviews.title: but it could be worse. I wanted it specifically because of the thickness
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what it says it is. A bit pricey, but it could be worse. I wanted it specifically because of the thickness, but it's still compact enough where I can store it under my bed when not in use, and I can use it for exercising at home.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R.

customer_reviews.title: Super high quality soft mat
customer_reviews.text: Although I have decided to return the mat, this a well done, high quality mat that fir sure will stay for a very long time. The stitches, zippers and handles are all do e with high quality materials. I have decided to return it due to softness if the mat. It was too soft for my old back as I beed stronger support while working on my pilates training.
customer_reviews.author: ZafdielDeGato

customer_reviews.title: Not a true gymnastics mat
customer_reviews.text: We bought these mats for our 7 year old daughter who is really into gymnastics and needed some protection from the ground when flipping over her handstands. However, they are not very sturdy, nothing like a true mat you would find at the gymnastics classes, doubled up you could maybe use them for sleeping on. Also they are missing the Velcro pieces that hold them together! I was bummed about that because I needed them to connect in order to give enough space for tumbling. On the plus side, they make for really fun rides down the stairs and they fold up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Britnae D.

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS
customer_reviews.text: This is a soft mat with low density foam. That means it good for stretching on & not the best mat to do gymnastics on. My spine doesnt like hard mats when i stretch so this is THE PERFECT MAT FOR ME. I am 200lbs & kneeling on it is comfortable. But if you are doing high impact stuff...not the right mat! Just my 2cents! I love it for what i use it for. If you are a very young child doing low impact gymnastics then maybe it would be fine.
customer_reviews.author: In the now!

customer_reviews.title: Good folding mat
customer_reviews.text: Great mat I purchased for sleeping when we go camping. It is a little bulky but perfect for the price. It is has a good thickness for sleeping on fairly flat ground. I wouldn't recommend on super rocky or bumpy ground as it is not SUPER thick so you would feel the rocks after a while.
customer_reviews.author: goobergurl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed. Perfect for doing the exercises that my physical therapist prescribed. I broke my knee several years ago and it is still tender to kneel on. This pad has the perfect amount of cushion for me to do the yoga type exercises.
customer_reviews.author: e. latt

customer_reviews.title: Cheap as hell!
customer_reviews.text: Not firm at all. Feels like I'm just laying on the floor. I can't believe the regular price is $70!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hof

customer_reviews.title: Returned them
customer_reviews.text: Returned them; there's no way to join these side by side for larger coverage, and no anti-skid coating on bottom (they slide real easy on a hardwood or laminate floor).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer since inception

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap material and very squishy
customer_reviews.text: I was expected a mat similar to another I have that has smooth vinyl covering and a dense foam core. This one has a weird cloth like covering material and is so squishy there is no way you could work out effectively on it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect for the price. The material does seem a little thinner, but for my use it will be fine. It's light weight and stores easily which is convenient. Perfect if you just want something to do your ab workouts on :)
customer_reviews.author: MomOf2

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy and Easy to Store
customer_reviews.text: This China made mat is economical and it fold up nicely. It is a fairly soft 2" mat. I would like it a little harder for stretching and exercise. You will sink in a good inch. I think it would be perfect for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very uncomfortable using, slides all over the place while using and causing to lose balance. Padding in this is terrible. Might as well be using the hardwood floors because that’s what I felt while trying to use this mat. Needless to say, it’s sitting in the corner and I’ve ordered a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap machine stitches holding 3 parts together.
customer_reviews.text: I’m 200lbs. This mat has machine stitches holding it together which are super fragile . After doing workout on it for just 10 days, the stitches came out. And now it’s useless. Also don’t buy if you have wooden floor in your apartment. You’ll need another mat to hold it. It’s slippery
customer_reviews.author: Shashank Jain

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I like this Matt because it’s thick enough to support the back. It’s a little bit more of a cushion. But I paid for $37. They just recently raised the price up for almost $60 NOT WORTH IT
customer_reviews.author: Susu CC

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Not durable, the foam is too squishy, doesn't protect me from the hardwood floor. It also gives too much when doing standard moves like planks. Not sure how it's getting such high reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Gansky

customer_reviews.title: Larger than expected when folded
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy. They suite my purpose, which is to have a surface for floor stretches so I'm not directly on the floor. They slip on the hardwood floors; nothing on the underside to keep them in place. When they fold up, they are considerably larger than I thought. I wanted it to fold up to go under my bed, but it's too thick. I have to store it in the closet, which is not what I wanted. If I were to make a similar purchase in the future, I'd likely try a yoga mat instead. These mats are difficult to store.
customer_reviews.author: Susanls67

customer_reviews.title: Nope not worth it! Cheap!
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this mat! It was way to flint and cheap it hurt my knee when I tried it for the first time it was like I was still on the cement working out! I returned it and got my money back!
customer_reviews.author: Sin

customer_reviews.title: Not at all as expected
customer_reviews.text: This is completely different than what appears on the website. The fabric cover us rough and not comfortable for exercises. I wanted something more firm but the cushion is too soft. I returned it next day.
customer_reviews.author: Pritesh

customer_reviews.title: Soft cushions slick material
customer_reviews.text: I love how foldable it is but on my hardwoods it’s very slick I have to be careful doing certain moves material is like a durable rain jacket material. The cushions are not very firm.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica S Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Best exercise Matt on the market period!
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, easy to store and great thickness in the foam. Makes exercising very relaxing, oh also the covers can be unzipped for washed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: This sucked. It was a rough material. And when you step in it, it sinks in to almost the floor. I have other brands and this was horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Hard as a rock
customer_reviews.text: This mat was way to hard for me. I am use to the nice two inch professional padded mats from the gym. The whole purpose of having a mat is to provide cushioning between your body and the floor. This mat did not provide any more cushioning than the 1 cm mats provide. Also, there was a crease underneath the covering on one of the panels that spanned the entire width of one of the panels. So essentially this would have limited the mat to only one side for smooth surface use. The mat also had a VERY strong petroleum smell. Made me wonder if it might have been toxic. I ended up returning mine for a higher quality mat.
customer_reviews.author: Dsl Creative

customer_reviews.title: Costly, but the best mat you'll find
customer_reviews.text: This is well worth the money. You get a sufficiently padded mat that can be cleaned if you are so inclined. Not a requirement, but an option. It's big - you won't find yourself angry that parts are spilling off the ship. The padding, once again, is amazing. Tailbone will thank you at the same time that your abdominals tell you to pi$$ off.
customer_reviews.author: L. K.

customer_reviews.title: Cushy!
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived on time and in great condition. It is very easy to clean and is super cushy for my knees and wrists. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: ELK

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mat at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic at 25$ each I bought two. I use them in the back of my golf vw for car camping or in the tent if we decide to use it. Perfect for yoga or kettle bell workouts. Great color (black) thick padding! Perfect for movie nights too!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Good wide matt
customer_reviews.text: I have had this matt for a few months now and use for some casual stretching and floor exercises. The outer material does not seem as thick as my old matt that the dog dug a hole in....but....so far it has held up. I think you will like it. I do not think I am going to risk walking on it with shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Larry S

customer_reviews.title: This mat is a cheap piece of crap. It slides around on the floor like crazy
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This mat is a cheap piece of crap. It slides around on the floor like crazy. There's no way you could do exercises using this thing. Wish I could return.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa Glover

customer_reviews.title: Read below.....
customer_reviews.text: One of the zippers on the first one we had delivered broke after a few uses and it was sharp and another zipper was bent. After asking for a replacement, the second replacement arrived with mold on the handles!!!! The material is not typical gym mat material and looks cheaper and like it'll rip easily, but you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: jros

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: The 4 Stars is because it's a little noisy when I do Yuga on it because of the material it's made of.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and store
customer_reviews.text: I like the mat because it is thicker and comfortable to lay on and stretch. I place it in front of the TV and exercise while watching a movie. Then it is very easy to fold and fits nicely behind the sofa. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... my little brother who is disabled and they worked great. I bought two
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use as playmats for my little brother who is disabled and they worked great. I bought two, and put a full size sheet over to hold it together as one and it was perfect. Fold up and store nicely. Even comfy enough for a nap or two ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my daughter who is a gymnastic enthusiast for Christmas. Best $30 I ever spent! Well worth it! She tumbles, cartwheels, headstand rolls, and so much more. My 2 boys have taken quite a liking to them, too. They throw them around at times and are not gentle with them and they hold up great. There are a lot of uses for these mats. Love that they fold up and have handles and the support is just right. I highly recommend these, in fact we ended up getting another set because they all enjoy them so very much.
customer_reviews.author: S. Agrella

customer_reviews.title: I LIKE IT!
customer_reviews.text: the mat is firm enough to lie on the floor and do stretches - it is comfortable, long and wide enough - since i just got it, i can't say how well it will hold up but it looks like it's fairly well made - if it doesn't hold up reasonably well, i will amend this review - but for now, i give it 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Working out on the patio is now much more comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a way to do sit-ups outside without getting sore and dirty and this checked all the boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Great portable exercise mat.
customer_reviews.text: My dog ate our old mat so we had to order a new one. This was our choice and is exactly what we were looking for. It is comfortable and portable. One thing I would like to see different is that it be made out of some type of vinyl so I can be easily cleaned after a workout.
customer_reviews.author: Magnolia Hill

customer_reviews.title: Density is not good. While thick
customer_reviews.text: Density is not good. While thick, the density isnt there. Only slightly better than being directly on the concrete floor.
customer_reviews.author: Barr

customer_reviews.title: Cushioning does not last
customer_reviews.text: After one month It is no longer cushioning and can feel hard floor through it.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow to lay on comfortably. Might be OK for kids.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice mat that is soft enough to sleep on for hours. It's drawback is that it is very narrow. I have another mat that is big enough to sleep on and roll over on. If you move at all on this mat, a part of your body is going to come off of it. It might be OK for small children. I would recommend avoiding it and getting a wider one for comfort if you are an adult or bigger than a small child. Even if it cost a little bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: Great for Working Out
customer_reviews.text: I have hardwood floors and this was a huge game changer to working out at home. Very comfortable but still sturdy enough to work out on.
customer_reviews.author: User 1

customer_reviews.title: so sad
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mat for my daughter for Christmas. The mat looked sturdy and was exactly what she wanted. I was pleased w/ it too until now..... it already broke!!!! The mat ripped!!! My child has had it for 10 days and it broke already????? 4 out of the 10 days we were traveling so she hasn't even played on it that much. I'm so disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: sue

customer_reviews.title: for the price it does what it needs to do ...
customer_reviews.text: for the price it does what it needs to do. it's a cushion/mat for a small child to perform very basic tumbling ie. rolls and bridges. it slides quite a bit so even cartwheels can make it move, which can cause some accidents. mostly my kids use it to make forts
customer_reviews.author: andrea roehm

customer_reviews.title: Mat not suitable for yoga or exercise! Ripped easily!
customer_reviews.text: Ripped on the first try! Don’t buy this product and it is not easy too store. It’s not the proper mat for yoga or any other exercise for that matter! Don’t buy it! Look for something else!
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Springy exercise mat
customer_reviews.text: This foam-core mat was exactly what I was looking for. It is light-weight and folds away easily for storage. I needed a mat I could use for jogging-in-place or skipping rope in my home exercise room. My space has tile floors, so a simple carpet on top was not sufficient. This mat proved to be a good solution, priced much less than the professional-grade gym mats, but having a couple of inches of foam, making it comparable in function.
customer_reviews.author: Rima A. Kamal

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The price is cheap enough to where if this isn't was you were looking for it's not a huge loss and you'll probably find use for it somehow. If you are looking for something that is similar to a firm gymnastics/wrestling/exercise mat this is not going to work for you. it's far too soft, however it substitutes a sleeping pad pretty good and made for a fantastic replacement for an outdoor dog bed.
customer_reviews.author: MD Stovalli

customer_reviews.title: I love that it folds and has a handle-thick enough for ...
customer_reviews.text: my daughter loves this, was the winner for xmas gifts. She puts shelf gripper on our hardwoood floors and then lays this on top so it doessnt slide and flips down the hallway till her hearts content. I love that it folds and has a handle-thick enough for her to fall while practicing flips but still compact enough to store behind her bedroom door. Was the best price I found and shpped quickly with free ship-at xmas!
customer_reviews.author: A.M.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great mat for my physiotherapy stretches and exercises but not ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mat for my physiotherapy stretches and exercises but not very good for Yoga. The mat is pretty thick and cushiony so it's really hard on the wrists if you try to do Yoga on it. But I bought it for physio and it works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Erick Racedo

customer_reviews.title: but it's not the best, as the foam inside is cheap
customer_reviews.text: It does the job, but it's not the best, as the foam inside is cheap. So for certain things, like stretching where one knee is on it and you are having to put all of your weight down, it hurts because it's almost as if you had no mat!
customer_reviews.author: Taihina T.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mat because my other yoga mat was very thin and it hurt my knees during certain exercises. This mat is really thick and is very well made. I would recommend this mat.
customer_reviews.author: kcole

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad product but very thin and small
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected and wouldn't work for what I needed them for so I returned them. Slight issue returning them but it was fixed immediately after I called to let them know. Not a bad product but very thin and small. I would not recommend buying this for martial arts or gymnastics but would probably be ok for yoga or stretching.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great deal. A bit too squishy for our needs, makes it a bit harder for balance. but it does get you off the floor at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: John Kite

customer_reviews.title: I was hoping it'd be like mats at the gym that you cannot feel the ...
customer_reviews.text: This mat I would consider to be just okay. I was hoping it'd be like mats at the gym that you cannot feel the floor beneath you but that is simply just not the case. For work with my Ab Roller I just leave it folded in a square so that I do not feel the hard concrete of my garage floor on my knees. For the price I suppose it's a good buy, but if you're in need of something with a little more substance I might consider a higher price tag.
customer_reviews.author: HerLivingRoomHero

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great product!!
customer_reviews.text: These are so great for all sorts of uses. My clients use when I do healing work. Very comfortable and do not deflate like air mattresses. I can't lay on the floor without cushioning, these do the trick. So light weight, with carrying straps easy to tote around and throw in your car.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I was not doing certain workouts because of how much the ground hurt my knees and tail bone this solves everything and is compact and stores easily
customer_reviews.author: Jessika Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping my little wall-kicker safe and quiet.
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old kicks the wall when he sleeps (he's strange), and so we wanted something thin to go in-between his bed and the wall to detonate the sounds of his kicking, as well as prevent him from hurting himself. We wedged this mat and it works great, and wasn't too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: AbbyM

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I use this at work, its great to reduce stress when I'm on break.
customer_reviews.author: TinaS

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves to sleep on it instead of a bed
customer_reviews.text: Does what I need. Grandson likes to sleep on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gym folding map for my daughter for Christmas. With in one month it has already ripped on all the corners and torn up. She does not even use this on a regular basis. The quality is very very poor. I would not recommend this product to anyone. I am very disappointed with Amazon and the return policy on this mat. She received it for Christmas and didn't start using it first week in January. It is now only one month later and the return policy from Amazon says not returnable. Do not buy if you want something that will last!
customer_reviews.author: Shannen Manso

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO USE COMFORTABLE.
customer_reviews.text: EASY TO USE AND COMFORTABLE FOR MORNING EXERCISES. QUICKLY FOLDS AND STORES IN SECONDS.
customer_reviews.author: smokeydog38

customer_reviews.title: Toddler tumbler
customer_reviews.text: My 2 yr old likes to do somersaults on the couch. In an effort to encourage the gymnastic play in a more safe manor, I bought this pad. Works great, thick padding, and folds up to a nice size when put away. She does head stands and sommersault safely
customer_reviews.author: Janee Sommerfeld

customer_reviews.title: It is wonderful. My old one was getting hard
customer_reviews.text: It is wonderful. My old one was getting hard. The new one is great when I have to be on my knees
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: This thing is horrible. You can feel the floor through this. Feels like it has padding but doesn’t provide support. It hurts your knees.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie J

customer_reviews.title: great for home work outs
customer_reviews.text: so great for at home work outs! I wanted something more than a yoga mat to keep my spine and back from hurting while doing floor exercises and this is just perfect
customer_reviews.author: Goldie

customer_reviews.title: This by far is a very good product I just wish that it was a little ...
customer_reviews.text: This by far is a very good product I just wish that it was a little bit wider. My basement floor is pretty hard on my back for during back exercises but with this mat it is much better. The mat reminds me of the ones that we had back in high school for wresting. It is nice and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. LooseCannon

customer_reviews.title: I use this for my daily workouts
customer_reviews.text: It gives the right amount of cushioning support and I like the way it folds to be put away.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Good price, but not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: Good price, but not the best quality. The outer fabric feels and sounds like a wind breaker/ rain coat material. The foam is not very firm either.
customer_reviews.author: addiefrank

customer_reviews.title: When done it folds up and goes easily in the closet
customer_reviews.text: I have hardwood floors and needed something thicker than a yoga mat to do stretching. When done it folds up and goes easily in the closet.
customer_reviews.author: TerCar

customer_reviews.title: Toddler mat
customer_reviews.text: We use this next to our toddler's new "big boy" bed in case he falls out at night. It has done a perfect job of providing a soft landing, and doubles up as his yoga mat during the day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for child gymnast!
customer_reviews.text: we bought this for our daughter to practice her gymnastics at home and it works great for that, she only weighs about 40 lbs. It is a bit soft for an adult though which makes it great for a pad to sleep on or maybe for sit ups on a hard surface. this is exactly what we wanted for our daughter though, great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Shindokwan

customer_reviews.title: Very nicely cushioned mats!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for that I couldn't find locally. The mats are very cushiony and the covering is very durable. Would definitely recommend this mat!
customer_reviews.author: abopp106

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my mat and LOVE it! It’s the perfect thickness, comfortable, and easy to use. Very affordable, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: E. peterson

customer_reviews.title: and this mat is great. It provides some cushion while maintaining enough firmness ...
customer_reviews.text: I have to do daily floor exercises, and this mat is great. It provides some cushion while maintaining enough firmness without hurting my back. I recommend this to everyone. It's not mean to be too cushioned so you won't feel the ground. Some firmness is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Pegah A.

customer_reviews.title: The padding is inadequate
customer_reviews.text: This mat is too slippery to use. I do Pilates much of which involves balancing in the butt. I am 5'7 155 pounds. The padding is not dense enough and squashes down to the floor. I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Good firmness for sleeping upon or massage.
customer_reviews.text: A bit softer than a tumbling mat. Used it for camping on top of a firm tumbling mat and slept like a baby.
customer_reviews.author: Buffalo Bill

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have needed one of these for years for extra yogurt cushioning and stretching and I finally got it. Quite happy I did
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Navia

customer_reviews.title: Great mat for a variety of exercises
customer_reviews.text: For Christmas, we got a Wii Fit Plus. Though many of the exercises require nothing more than a hard floor and the Wii Fit balance board, there are times when an exercise mat would be a nice companion. My wife and I have found this to be perfect for that purpose. The mat seems very durable, and is very comfortable. I would not hesitate to buy another just like it.
customer_reviews.author: N. Krumpe

customer_reviews.title: Good mat for small child
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this mat for my 5 year old daughter. It works well for in home tumbling, however it is a bit small for what we wanted. I did read the dimensions before ordering and I thought it would be a good size, however a 4x8 would be a better fit. The mat is sturdy and has held up well. I do like it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Happy wife!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what my wife was looking for! Right size and thickness. She's happy, therefore I am as well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You'll sink in pretty soon and the cushioning effect gone too
customer_reviews.text: Thick, but does not hold up to a little weight. You'll sink in pretty soon and the cushioning effect gone too. And I'm 120 lbs..
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Good price and comfortable! :)
customer_reviews.text: The price of this was cheaper than I thought it would be, been using it daily, and I can do exercises more comfortably than just being on the hard floor.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. McGovern

customer_reviews.title: Quality is low
customer_reviews.text: The mat quality is very low. The brand is not VIP. They are just the sellers. So don't get surprised if you see another brand PRINTED on the mat that they don't show you here on their picture. Also the mat IS NOT 2" Thick. The actual size is 1 INCH. So take that into consideration before buying this product. Well at the end I returned this mat and got a full refund. So their customer service is good.
customer_reviews.author: Tico

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you want a good mat
customer_reviews.text: For the price of the mat, you'd expect to get something that's good quality. I never write reviews but this mat was completely terrible quality. The foam is practically non-existent and you may as well not have ordered a mat.
customer_reviews.author: T Shab

customer_reviews.title: Great padding for those who need it
customer_reviews.text: This works for me. Since I've had knee problems, my older, thinner exercise mat was not good for me. I would prefer it to be slightly wider, however. And the thickness is not the best for some types of exercises; it all depends what you need it for. The folds make it easy to carry and easy to store, but sometimes one has to change position because of them; that is a minor issue, however, a tradeoff.
customer_reviews.author: redbarn66

customer_reviews.title: It was perfect for her size but after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I had bought this mat for my daughter, who uses it every day. It was perfect for her size but after 2 weeks, the seem has split. I'm disappointed with this. I'm going to try to duct tape it but I'm not happy a $60 mat split in 15 days.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Feierstein

customer_reviews.title: durable
customer_reviews.text: Durable nylon cover and cushion, perfect for planking, easier on the elbows than carpet or flooring.
customer_reviews.author: Toe Cutter

customer_reviews.title: Tore in less than a month of use!!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this thick pad As I have some lower back issues but after 3rd week of use (and not daily) it has started tearing right down the stitching. Now I am back to searching for a thick mat.. bummer
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Maddox

customer_reviews.title: It is too soft...
customer_reviews.text: In spite of its thickness, it is too soft and it really doesn't create a good protection when exercising. It is better to spend a little bit more, but get a better quality product
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Eduardo Silva

customer_reviews.title: Good price since I will use to pad gym walls
customer_reviews.text: Good price since I will use to pad gym walls. This is not a regular mat vinyl though. More like a windbreaker jacket. Hair sticks to it
customer_reviews.author: kim bonoan

customer_reviews.title: they are comfortable, didn't feel hard at all
customer_reviews.text: Use these as a mat to sleep in the back of my jeep. they are comfortable, didn't feel hard at all, you can use em in your house to sleep on if need be instead of a bed, open more space up. Will update on wear if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable to exercise on to me
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a great option for exercising with. My house is tile so I thought this would help but it is not comfortable to exercise on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my wife. She is happy with it and, so am I. The reason I gave it 4 stars was because, it is not quite what I expected. I thought it would be more like the mats I remember from school but, its softer than that. Still a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Sunny Health & Fitness Folding Gymnastics Tumbling Mat - Extra Thick with Carry Handles - for Exercise, Yoga, Fitness, Aerobics, Martial Arts, Cardio
feature_bullets: TRI FOLD MAT: This exercise mat helps ensure that exercises, such as crunches and leg extensions, are carried out on adequate cushioning. At 6-ft in length, it allows most users to lie down comfortably.

LIGHTWEIGHT & PORTABLE: Integrated two carrying nylon handles make transportation convenient, and the tri-fold design is compact to fit easily into closets, car trunks, or in storage units at the gym.

COMFORTABLE PADDING: Features 2-inch padding for extra comfort and support during a variety of training exercises, ideal for activities and exercises such as yoga, core strengthening, stretching, Pilates, and martial arts.

VERSATILE: Ideal for all skill levels, beginners to advanced, and exercising at home or in the gym with the team. This is also perfect as a spare bed, or as a floor mat, yoga, Pilates or exercise mat, futon mattress, or for a children's play area
CONVENIENT NYLONE STRAPS – Grip the slip resistant bands to carry your yoga mat on the go! No need to struggle with carrying the entire mat in your arms.
